summary:
## King James Version (KJV) of the Bible

The King James Version (KJV) is a famous English translation of the Bible, published in 1611. King James VI and I of England ordered its creation. It has 80 books, including the Old Testament, New Testament, and Apocrypha.

The KJV is known for its beautiful language and is still used by many Protestant Christians today. It was the third English translation approved by the Church of England and was influenced by earlier versions like the Geneva Bible.

The KJV was designed to avoid the Puritan views found in the Geneva Bible and support the Church of England's beliefs. It became the most popular English Bible for centuries.
title: King James Version
